headline.main: BIRD ISLAND --WHO OWNS IT!; Acquisition of Derelict Territory. INTERESTING OFFICIAL DOCUMENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have received, through our Washington Correspondent, a copy of the following interesting and instructive letter, addressed to the Secretary of Stte by PHILO S. SHELTON, Esq., of Boston: BOSTON, Monday, May 14, 1855.
docs.snippet: We have received, through our Washington Correspondent, a copy of the following interesting and instructive letter, addressed to the Secretary of Stte by PHILO S. SHELTON, Esq., of Boston: BOSTON, Monday, May 14, 1855.

docs.lead_paragraph: It will be seen from a couple of addresses which we publish in another column, that several members of the Whig General Committee of this City have seceded from the regular organization, and ask to be themselves recognized as the only genuine, simon pure Whig Committee in the City. The grounds of this modest request are not very distinctly stated.

headline.main: CITY POLITICS.; Rebellious Demonstration of Discontented Whigs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. S. S. WARD, and two other gentlemen, have suceded from the Whig party, as represented by Whig General Committee, and have organized themselves into a new Whig party,--on the basis supposed to he indicated in the following addresses which they have sent us for publication: TO THE WHIGS OF NEW-YORK COTY. CONSTITUTION HALL, May 16.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Dog Pound Controversy--Mr. Bedell in Reply to Mr. McKellar. City Mortality. Advancement of Education. Was it a Theft? Inquests--Death from Burning Fluid. Grand Larceny. An Alleged Household Theft. A Small Larceny. Arrest of Prize Fighters. Lectures to the Hollanders in their Own Language. A Hard Case. Educational. City Missionary Society. Fine Arts. Attempt to Murder a Keeper of the City Prison. Board of Supervisors. Mayor's Office. Highway Robbery. COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Board of Aldermen. Board of Councilmen. A Foundling.

docs.lead_paragraph: To Alderman Briggs, Chairman of the Police Investigating Committee: DAR SIR--As the immaculate Mr. McKELLAR has pretended to give a full account of his connection with the Dog Pound, and has endeavored in that statement to prejudice the Court against this Committee by false insinuations, and as I shall prove, false state-
